Hey!  Someone I recognize from the LJ!!  (Not that there's anything 
going on over there at the moment.)  Glad you got things straightened 
out with Yahoo... I *know* how long THAT can take.   

We've gots lots of Saitou fans and some PMK Harada fans.  I'll let 
past messages from Barb introduce you to the stylish-fundoshi version 
of Harada from the live-action drama from NHK.  :-D  I'm just about 
to get started watching some of that series.  Lots of references to 
film and television series featuring the Shinsengumi & the times... 
unfortunatly buried in messages right now (unless someone has 
compiled a film/tv list and posted it to Files?).  If you get 
confused like I do keeping them all straight, don't hesitate to ask 
questions.  Oh, and if you haven't already, consider signing up on 
miburo so you can access the files that are over there.  It's mostly 
acting as storage space and full of info.  
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/miburo .

So... Japanese language skills, eh?  (very wicked grin, rubbing 
hands... and not just me)  Two years or three, you HAVE to be better 
than babelfish...  :-D

You don't have to have any translation skills to be welcome.  We're 
always glad to have more miburo fans to join the fun.

phil

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, Mirel <gryps_celsus@c...> wrote:
> Konnichi wa minna-san!
> I'm new here and I'm totally excited to finally get myself in this 
group (I 
> was having arguments with Yahoo about the existence of my 
account).  I am 
> really interested in learning all I can about the Shinsengumi and 
its 
> members, and I've heard this is THE PLACE to get and share info in 
English.
> Just as an intro, I'll give a quick rundown of what I'm into, ne?  
Let's 
> see, my fav. member is Saitou Hajime, although Peacemaker Kurogane 
has 
> gotten me quite curious about Harada Sanosuke as well.  As for 
anime, I've 
> seen Kenshin and PMK and I am digging for more.  In manga, I've 
read a 
> bunch of PMK and I have a bunch of scanlations sitting on my 
computer 
> waiting for attention.  As for live action stuff, this is where I 
am 
> horribly deficient, but I hope to fix that soon!
> I've also taken two years of Japanese and would be going into my 
3rd year 
> if it weren't for the fact that I'm going to Tanzania this fall.  I 
love 
> learning about other aspects Japanese history outside of the 
Shinsengumi 
> and the areas I'm most interested in include the Sengoku jidai (age 
of 
> civil wars), the Edo period, and the Meiji Restoration.
> Also, I'm currently working on a full Shinsengumi uniform (minus 
the armor, 
> because that would be really hard to make) to wear to this year's 
Otakon in 
> Baltimore, so any tips on such would be greatly appreciated.
> 
> Well that's about it!
> I look forward to many more e-mails wrought with Shinsengumi 
goodness!
> 
> Tootles!
> 
> 
>
